physical_appearance: On the cover of the book, the title, substitle, and publisher's name can be found. It is also underlined in blue.  Along the right edge of the book are white strings that reveal how the book has been bound. Beneath the title is an illustration of palm trees and aeroplanes in flight.
sgcool_label_text: Published in 1942, this book is an extensive photographic survey of the regions of Southeast Asia under Japanese colonial rule during the Pacific War, including the Philippines, French Indochina, Thailand, Burma, Malaya, Borneo and Singapore. It was edited by Utsunomiya Ken, and published by Nihon Rekishi Kenky?kai (Japanese History Research Group). As a propagandistic publication, it intended to promote the concept of ‘brotherhood’ amongst Southeast Asian people under the Japanese Empire.
title_text: The Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere by Utsunomiya Ken
subject_terms_2: Southeast Asia  Photographic surveying  Propaganda, Japanese  Colonies  World War, 1939-1945 Books Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere  Utsunomiya Ken  Nihon Rekishi Kenky?kai
